00001 #ifndef __PhysicsEngine_h_
00002 #define __PhysicsEngine_h_

00004 #include <vector>
00005 #include <OgreVector3.h>
00006 #include <OgreQuaternion.h>
00007 
00008 using namespace Ogre;
00009 
00010 /**
00011  * Enumeration used for differentiating between different types of PhysicsObjects
00012  * TODO: This should probably be handled through subclassing
00013  */
00014 enum ObjectType { SHIP, PROJECTILE };
00015 
00016 
00017 /**
00018  * The BaseObject class represents an entity in the OreWar game world.
00019  * BaseObjects use an X, Y, Z coordinate system following Ogre's axis conventions.
00020  * (see http://www.ogre3d.org/tikiwiki/Basic+Tutorial+1&structure=Tutorials)
00021  * The coordinate system is centered with 0,0,0 in the exact center of the game
00022  * world. Orientation is stored as a quaternion with <0, 0, -1> as the base
00023  * heading (to correspond with the default for Ogre cameras, scene nodes, etc.)
00024  */
00025 class BaseObject
00026 {
00027 private:
00028     /** The current position of the object */
00029     Vector3 m_position;
00030 
00031     /** The current orientation of the object (as a rotation from the base <0, 0, -1> heading) */
00032     Quaternion m_orientation;
00033 
00034 public:
00035 
00036     /** Construct a new BaseObject at a specified position with default heading (<0, 0,-1>) */
00037     BaseObject(Vector3 position);
00038 
00039     /** Copy constructor */
00040     BaseObject(const BaseObject& copy);
00041 
00042     /** Construct a new BaseObject at the origin with default heading (<0, 0,-1>) */
00043     BaseObject();
00044 
00045     /** Yaw the object by the specified number of radians (positive for right yaw) */
00046     void yaw(Radian radians);
00047 
00048     /** Roll the object by the specified number of radians (positive for counter-clockwise roll) */
00049     void roll(Radian radians);
00050 
00051     /** Pitch the object by the specified number of radians (positive for forward pitch) */
00052     void pitch(Radian radians);
00053 
00054     /** Sets the position of the object */
00055     void setPosition(Vector3 position);
00056 
00057     /** @return The position of the object */
00058     Vector3 getPosition() const;
00059 
00060     /** @return The heading of the object (normalised vector pointing "forward" fom it's current orientation) */
00061     Vector3 getHeading() const;
00062 
00063     /** @return The normal vector of the object (normalised vector pointing "up" from it's current orientation) */
00064     Vector3 getNormal() const;
00065 
00066     /** @return The orientation quaternion of the object (with <0, 0, -1> as the base heading) */
00067     Quaternion getOrientation() const;
00068 
00069     /** Sets the orientation of the object */
00070     void setOrientation(Quaternion orientation);
00071 };
00072 
00073 
00074 /**
00075  * The PhysicsObject class represents an object in the OreWar game world which is subject
00076  * to physics simulation. Physics objects have a set mass, and forces can be applied
00077  * to produce motion when the updatePosition() method is called. The velocity and acceleration
00078  * can also be directly manipulated in cases where forces are unnecessary. All properties
00079  * use the same coordinate orientation as those in the BaseObject class.
00080  */
00081 class PhysicsObject : public BaseObject
00082 {
00083 private:
00084     /** The type of the object (see ObjectType enum) */
00085     ObjectType m_type;
00086 
00087     /** The mass of the object */
00088     Real m_mass;
00089 
00090     /** The velocity of the object */
00091     Vector3 m_velocity;
00092 
00093     /** The acceleration of the object */
00094     Vector3 m_acceleration;
00095 
00096     /** The sum vector of all forces current applied on the object */
00097     Vector3 m_force;
00098 public:
00099     /** 
00100      * Construct a PhysicsObject at the given position coordinates with the
00101      * specified mass and default heading (<0, 0, -1>).
00102      */
00103     PhysicsObject(ObjectType type, Real mass, Vector3 position);
00104 
00105     /**
00106      * Construct a PhysicsObject at the origin with the specified mass 
00107      * with default heading (<0, 0, -1>)
00108      */
00109     PhysicsObject(ObjectType type, Real mass);
00110 
00111     /** Copy constructor */
00112     PhysicsObject(const PhysicsObject& copy);
00113 
00114     /** @return The type of the object (see ObjectType enum) */
00115     ObjectType getType() const;
00116 
00117     /** @return The mass of the object */
00118     Real getMass() const;
00119 
00120     /** Sets the velocity of the object */
00121     void setVelocity(Vector3 velocity);
00122 
00123     /** Sets the acceleration of the object */
00124     void setAcceleration(Vector3 acceleration);
00125 
00126     /** @return The velocity of the object */
00127     Vector3 getVelocity() const;
00128 
00129     /** @return The acceleration of the object */
00130     Vector3 getAcceleration() const;
00131 
00132     /** @return The vector sum of all forces on the object */
00133     Vector3 getSumForce() const;
00134 
00135     /** 
00136      * Applies an addititve force on the object which will be taken into account
00137      * on the next physics update.
00138      */
00139     void applyForce(Vector3 force);
00140 
00141     /** Cancel all force currently applied to the object */
00142     void clearForces();
00143 
00144     /**
00145      * Updates the object's position, taking all physics parameters into
00146      * account as well as the time elapsed since the last position update
00147      * (in seconds).
00148      */
00149     virtual void updatePhysics(Real timeElapsed);
00150 };
00151 
00152 #endif
